info.title: clients-addresses
info.description:
This is the entry point for client addresses

#### Service Functionality
This API is called with a {clientId}, {addressId}, and/or {encodedId} parameter.  If successful, the result will be a http status code.

#### Diagrams
*Interaction*
#TBD

#### Performance Expectation
Standard SLA applies.
#### Service Capacity Supported
Standard Capacity applies

#### Suggested Test Scenario
TBD

#### Service Availability
Standard Service Availability applies

#### Service Security
HTTPS/SSL

put.description: For a given clientId and encodedAddressId, changes the associated address if exists.

schema.description:
Address model--used with various parent objects to describe the US Postal Service
location.

addressType.description: Future use.  If used, SHOULD be set to 'Mailing'.

addressAggregate.description: The aggregate address for use when the individual components are not known.

street1.description: First line of the postal address, e.g. 100 Main St.

street2.description: Second line of the postal address, e.g. Unit 100.

state.description: For domestic addresses, use USPS two-digit state code.

countyCode.description: Properties countyCode and county are mutually exclusive.  Use countyCode when the source system provides a two-character code.  If the source is the actual County name, then use the county property.

county.description: Properties countyCode and county are mutually exclusive.  Use countyCode when the source system provides a two-character code.  If the source is the actual County name, then use the county property.

townshipCode.description: Properties townshipCode and township are mutually exclusive.  Use townshipCode when the source system provides a two-character code.  If the source is the actual Township name, then use the township property.

township.description: Properties townshipCode and township are mutually exclusive.  Use townshipCode when the source system provides a two-character code.  If the source is the actual Township name, then use the township property.

postalCode.description: The USPS postal code, also known as the zip code.  Should be in the format ##### or #####-#### (zip plus four).

post.description: For a given clientId and encodedAddressId, corrects the associated address if exists.
